rComments: Yes, your grade hinged on 3 exams and a 1pg 'paper'. Yes, the tests were not the easiest. (STUDY STUDY STUDY cladistics and synapomorphies! Reading the textbook helps.) But c'mon, Yeakel was so enthusiastic and knowledgeable, and just a joy to learn from. He made an 8am a class I never wanted to miss.
Great class... Dinosaurs + star wars... Who knew? Definitely not an easy A. It was an awesome class...

Although the class and textbook was interesting for the most part, the tests were a whole different issue. The grading scheme is basically 1 paper that's worth 5%, 1 test that's worth 20%, and 3 more tests that're worth 25% each. I suggest you choose "P/NP" as your grading option because this class is far from an easy A.

I had Justin for Dinos...thought this class was gonna be fun but its actually really hard; your grade depends on exams only and those 4 exams were not easy. The professor was funny though and lectures were interesting, but overall it was hard (once again) and rather confusing. Good luck!
Really funny, especially for an 8 am class. I really enjoyed having him.

I took Eart 65 and it is a great class. You can tell he has enthusiasm for teaching this class. He is funny and I love the tests. There are four within the quarter, but this was very helpful!! If you go to class, read, and study, then you're good. It's not like those classes in which the tests are opposite of what the teacher teaches!! GREAT class!

If you're looking for an easy A, look elsewhere. The tests in dinosaurs require a LOT of studying, and they're very specific. Lectures aren't mandatory but a lot of the information and concepts that are taught aren't available on the online slideshows. On the bright side, the lectures are very entertaining, especially because Yeakel is such a geek.

Interesting class, but pretty hard especially if you aren't so good at multiple choice tests. So unless you LOVE dinosaurs more than anything AND/OR are good at taking multiple choice tests, I wouldn't take this for a GE because its pretty difficult. The teacher was okay I guess. Most people loved him, but I wasn't terribly enthralled with him.

Dinos is harder than you think. I took this course to merely attain credits and it turned out to be far more work than expected. Its not an easy A class. He is funny and makes various star wars jokes and Jurassic Park references, however his standardized tests are brutal and unforgiving. and those tests are your grade...no participation or essays.
